definition: variant of 新婚燕爾|新婚燕尔[xin1 hun1 yan4 er3]
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
to marry/marriage/wedding/to take a wife
feast/repose
variant of 宴[yan4]
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou
newly wed
the joy of matrimony (polite phrase referring to a young woman)
newlyweds
wedding night
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
couple living in destitute misery (idiom)
to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
new worries added to old hatred (idiom); afflicted by problems old and new
out of tune/marital discord, cf qin and se 琴瑟, two string instruments as symbol of marital harmony
sad feeling at separation (idiom)
(literary) (of a married woman) to visit one's parents
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
lit. to buy smiles to seek happiness/abandon oneself to the pleasures of the flesh (idiom)
to emphasize down to last detail (idiom); to show every possible consideration/meticulous care
to regard sb as a brother (idiom)
